page.title: 05Wildlife - Animals
page.content:
{Animal Life
There are many small mammals - mice, rats, voles, rabbits, moles, grey squirrels, hedgehogs and foxes. We can often see kestrels hovering. Buzzards too can often be seen,as well as tawny owls, barn owls, and little owls. We have an abundance of garden birds. The commonest are house sparrows, starlings and chaffinches. Most of the tit family are here - and the nuthatch and tree creeper are sometimes to be seen. Swallows, house martins,swifts and cuckoos are summer visitors.
The castle moat, where there are mallards, tufted ducks and greylag geese to feed and study, is a popular place with small children.
